publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7922 Bill Kidd: Biking for Bobath—That the Parliament applauds Julie McElroy for her upcoming Julie’s Bobath Challenge to raise funds and awareness for Bobath Scotland Children’s Therapy Centre in Glasgow, which supports children with cerebral palsy; further applauds the centre’s 16 years of continued service to children diagnosed with cerebral palsy; notes that Julie, age 25, who received therapy from Bobath Centre for her cerebral palsy, will be biking from Edinburgh to Glasgow on 31 March 2011 as the first leg of the challenge; further notes Julie’s many adventures to raise awareness and money for cerebral palsy charities across the United Kingdom, including crossing the Amazon Basin and scaling Ben Nevis, and commends Julie’s efforts to help children in Scotland, and wishes her best of luck in Julie’s Bobath Challenge and any future adventures that she may have to help those with cerebral palsy. Supported by: Sandra White*, Bill Butler*, Jamie McGrigor*, Bob Doris*, Stewart Maxwell*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-7922 Biking for Bobath (lodged on 8 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Stuart McMillan*, Patricia Ferguson*, Anne McLaughlin*
S3M-7922 Biking for Bobath (lodged on 8 February 2011) Elaine Murray*, Elaine Smith*
